pull.title: Refactor: move DisconnectedBlockTransactions implementation code to disconnected_transactions.cpp
pull.body:
This PR is a follow up to fix some review comments from #28385 

- Moved `DisconnectedBlockTransactions` implementation code  to `disconnected_transactions.cpp`
- Updated `DisconnectedBlockTransactions`  const `MAX_DISCONNECTED_TX_POOL` from kb to bytes.
- Fix nits and clang formats.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28385#pullrequestreview-1629400522
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28385#discussion_r1327921657

issue.title: [refactor] rewrite DisconnectedBlockTransactions to not use boost
issue.body:
Motivation
- I think it's preferable to use stdlib data structures instead of depending on boost if we can achieve the same thing.
- Also see #28335 for further context/motivation. This PR simplifies that one.

Things done in this PR:
- Add a bench for `DisconnectedBlockTransactions` where we reorg and the new chain has {100%, 90%, 10%} of the same transactions. AFAIU in practice, it's usually close to 100%.
- Rewrite `DisconnectedBlockTransactions` as a `std::list` + `unordered_map` instead of a boost multi index container.
  - On my machine, the bench suggests the performance is very similar.
- Move `DisconnectedBlockTransactions` from txmempool.h to its own kernel/disconnected_transactions.h. This struct isn't used by txmempool and doesn't have much to do with txmempool. My guess is that it's been living there for convenience since the boost includes are there.

events.body: Thanks for opening a followup! Did you want to pick up the memusage unit test too? (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/9dcef47e4d52b15ffe88be7ddf5ea626121e5f0d or a new one)

ACK 2517862abb2c2e111c259ad2a6498e352f026c92

Great job on moving the implementation code from the header file to disconnected_transactions.cpp. This was a necessary step, especially considering how significantly the code had grown.

events.message:
refactor: c-lang format pr 28385 diff

On origin/pr/28385
git diff -U0 HEAD~6.. | ./contrib/devtools/clang-format-diff.py -p1 -i -v
refactor: update `MAX_DISCONNECTED_TX_POOL` from kb to bytes
move only: move implementation code to disconnected_transactions.cpp

ensure duplicate transactions  are not added to `iters_by_txid`

In `AddTransactionsToBlock` description comment we have the asuumption
that callers will never pass multiple transactions with the same txid
We are asserting to ensure that does not happen.

comments.body: Can delete this too, since it's a class

A bit more accurate:
```suggestion
    /* Maximum allowed total DynamicMemoryUsage, in bytes. To be enforced in AddTransactionsFromBlock.  */
```
Question: what's the benefit of moving to cpp file? I thought maybe it saves users from including some things, but it seems about the same.

Motivation is from @stickies-v  review comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28385#pullrequestreview-1629400522
Its a better practice to have interfaces in a `.h` and implementation code in `.cpp` file, allows for more efficient compilation by preventing redundant recompilation of unchanged code, ensuring faster build times I think.

I dont think there will be need to have implementation code in the header files.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#source-code-organization
